archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University

did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: George Mason University. Special Collections and Archives.

did.abstract: This collection contains materials pertaining to Virginia Lampe's career as a community activist and advocate of mental health and mental retardation services. The materials include task-force reports and meeting minutes for the numerous mental health and regional planning boards on which she served, as well as correspondence with her husband Henry O. Lampe.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Virginia Lampe papers, C0158, Special Collections and Archives, George Mason University Libraries.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Special Collections and Archives staff. EAD markup completed by Eron Ackerman and Jordan Patty in April 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: Virginia Lampe actively served on several local hospital and mental health boards in Virginia, including the Community Mental Health and Mental Retardation Services Boards. She also served on regional planning committees in several counties, including Lenowisco, Cumberland Plateau, Mount Rogers, and New River Valley, as an advocate of mental health and mental retardation services for children.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials pertaining to Virginia Lampe's career as a community activist and advocate of mental health and mental retardation services. The materials include task-force reports and meeting minutes for the numerous mental health and regional planning boards on which she served, as well as correspondence with her husband Henry O. Lampe.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged by subject.
